intro: Torularia sulphurea, commonly known as the sulphur flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Compositae and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in sandy or rocky habitats. Its unique coloration and compact growth make it a distinctive addition to botanical gardens.
